text: General elections were held in Tonga on 10 and 11 March 1999 to elect members of the Legislative Assembly of Tonga.Legislative Elections for Tonga 1999 IFES Election Guide Voter turnout was 50.7%. Pro-reform candidates won a majority of seats, despite receiving fewer votes.Dieter Nohlen, Florian Grotz & Christof Hartmann (2001) Elections in Asia: A data handbook, Volume II, pp818-820 ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats !+/- |- |align=left|Anti-reform candidates||40,605||60.6||4||+1 |- |align=left|Pro-reform candidates*||26,432||39.4||5||-1 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes|| ||-||-||- |- |align=left|Total||27,867||100||9||0 |- |colspan=5 align=left|Source: Nohlen et al. |} * Including the Human Rights and Democracy Movement ===By constituency=== ===People's Representatives=== Tongatapu (3 members) # 'Akilisi Pohiva (HRDM) # Feleti Sevele (HRDM) # 'Esau Namoa (Independent) Vava'u (2 members) # James W. K. Harris (Independent) # Samiu Vaipulu (Independent) Eua (1 member) # Sunia Fili (HRDM) Niuas (1 member) # 'Aisea Ta'ofi (HRDM) Ha'apai (2 members) # Pita Vi (Independent) # 'Uliti Uata (HRDM) ==References== Tonga Category:1999 in Tonga Category:Elections in Tonga Category:March 1999 events in Oceania
title: 1999 Tongan general election
